definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Originally what was happening was all those loans were going through banks and financial intermediaries.
sentences.chinese: 起先做的是这些所有贷款要经过银行和金融中介机构。

sentences.english: They start out as vesicles that then stretch into stringy tubes.
sentences.chinese: 它们起先是小泡然后变成纤维管。

sentences.english: At first he had waved aside the litter-bearers with an angry toss of his head.
sentences.chinese: 起先，他曾生气地摇摇头，让担架员走开。

sentences.english: But my mother told me she was sure it was Ziyi.
sentences.chinese: 起先，我不能够相信它是子怡。

sentences.english: At first she thought they were admiring the high-tech store's modern design.
sentences.chinese: 起先她以为这些人是在欣赏新店中的高科技现代设计。

sentences.english: A brigadier of gendarmes, who seemed to be in command of the group, was standing near the door.
sentences.chinese: 一个警察队长，仿佛是率领那群人的，起先立在门边。

sentences.english: He started out small: fliers passed on the street to the chauffeurs of expensive cars.
sentences.chinese: 起先，他给大街上来往的名牌轿车里塞传单。

sentences.english: At first girl on opposite looks at me not friendly in the eyes, let me feel some discomforts.
sentences.chinese: 起先对面的女孩不友好的眼神，让我有些不安。

sentences.english: This astonishing statement is not as shocking as it might, at first, appear.
sentences.chinese: 起先，这种惊人的论述并没有如预料中那样令人震惊。

sentences.english: An increasing number of people sttechnique to rewisize thmight educ is not complete with grlistingu.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的人起先认识到教育不能随着毕业而遣散。

sentences.english: At first, Nora liked all her teachers with the exception of Mr. Burton.
sentences.chinese: 起先，除了柏顿先生之外，诺拉喜欢所有的老师。

sentences.english: Theynove prove to been quite working on this project since last year.
sentences.chinese: 他们从去年起先向来都在做这个项目。

sentences.english: At first Aleck enjoyed the fellowship of his classmates.
sentences.chinese: 起先亚力克很喜欢与同学们的伙伴关系。

sentences.english: Hamilton peers first at me then at the image.
sentences.chinese: 汉密尔顿起先凝视着我，又看了看照片。

sentences.english: At first this myth might seem true.
sentences.chinese: 起先这一扯谈观点看似正确。

sentences.english: It's on the small stages big drei'ms come alive.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的梦想都是从小舞台起先的。

definition: to sound out/to probe/to feel out/to try out
to expect/to presume/to think (sth is likely)
